channel.title: Anyone know anything about headphones/amps?
channel.description: I am looking into buying some Head Direct RE0 headphones and a Fiio E1 portable amp. Is this a good combo, or should I go for the Fiio E5 amp?

item.title: Anyone know anything about headphones/amps?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

inears can be very nice quality, but if you’re looking for hifi get proper headphones

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know anything about headphones/amps?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“blah bah7, post:9, topic:315859”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=412315.msg3040130#msg3040130 date=1259031931]
Haven’t ever heard any of those with good quality tbh, so sorry, i have no experience/knowledge there.
[/quote]

Just so you know, IEM’s those earbuds with little plastic caps that go into your earcanal, like these http://shopping.yahoo.com/p:Sennheiser%20IE8%20Headphones:1995450956

And yeah, Seennheiser is an option for me, but their IEM’s cost a bit much for me, look at the price of those IE8s i just posted[/quote]I am aware what they are, however they have yet to deliver decent sound into my ears. Btw, good headphones isolate sound just as well as those In-ear thingies.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know anything about headphones/amps?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

Speljohan:

Haven’t ever heard any of those with good quality tbh, so sorry, i have no experience/knowledge there.

Just so you know, IEM’s those earbuds with little plastic caps that go into your earcanal, like these http://shopping.yahoo.com/p:Sennheiser%20IE8%20Headphones:1995450956

And yeah, Seennheiser is an option for me, but their IEM’s cost a bit much for me, look at the price of those IE8s i just posted

Read full topic

@sanga282 wrote:

Spel’s suggestion of the Seinheiser are definitily worth considering i personally prefer Bose to Seinheiser but often i find to get the same quality from Bose headphones you have to spend a bit more

item.title: Anyone know anything about headphones/amps?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Go for a pair of Goldring DR-150 headphones, great sound quality (alternatively Seinheiser HD 595 or Koss Pro/4AAT Titanium), these are all great price vs quality headphones, budget hi-fi solutions
